definition: between the words and the lines (idiom); implied meaning/connotations
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: There are many rays of innovation between lines in the Reprot of the Sixteenth Congress.
sentences.chinese: 党的“十六大”报告字里行间处处闪烁着创新的光芒。

sentences.english: Think of, never sigh Qingchou, between the lines.
sentences.chinese: 想着，不觉轻轻叹息，清愁溢满字里行间。

sentences.english: She seeps her grief to them in the air of scholarly refinementbetween the lines.
sentences.chinese: 她把自己对他们的悲悯渗透在书卷气的字里行间。

sentences.english: The teacher interlined corrections on the student's themes.
sentences.chinese: 字里行间，教师加进了修改的文字。

sentences.english: Reveal between the lines forward to the long-awaited home deep memory.
sentences.chinese: 字里行间流露着对久别故乡的深怀念。

sentences.english: Savvy Chinese media consumers know how to read between the lines.
sentences.chinese: 理解能力超强的中国媒体受众读得懂字里行间的深意。

definition: to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
to read out loud/(computing) to read (data)/readout (of a scientific instrument)
to be full of (emotion)/to brim with (love, tears etc)
to appear vividly on paper (idiom); to show forth vividly (in writing, painting etc)/to stand out markedly
